Tasks.Task Description: Identify the security requirements for accessing Azure VMs through Azure Bastion. Determine compliance needs and security policies.
Design the architecture for Azure Bastion deployment, including network configurations, subnet requirements, and integration with existing security measures.
Create a dedicated subnet for Azure Bastion in the virtual network. Ensure it meets the requirements for Azure Bastion deployment.
Provision the Azure Bastion service in the designated subnet. Configure the necessary settings for secure access to VMs.
Configure NSGs to restrict access to the Azure Bastion subnet. Define rules to allow only necessary traffic and block unauthorized access.
Enable security features such as Azure AD authentication and role-based access control (RBAC) for managing access to Azure Bastion.
Set up logging and monitoring for Azure Bastion using Azure Monitor and Azure Security Center. Ensure alerts are configured for suspicious activities.
Perform security testing on the Azure Bastion setup, including penetration testing and vulnerability assessments to identify potential security gaps.
Document the security policies and procedures related to Azure Bastion usage, including access controls and incident response plans.
Regularly review and update security measures for Azure Bastion to ensure compliance with evolving security standards and best practices.
Regularly review and update security policies related to Azure Bastion to ensure they align with organizational security standards and best practices.
Continuously monitor Azure Bastion logs for any unauthorized access attempts or anomalies. Utilize Azure Monitor and Log Analytics for effective log management.
Perform regular security audits of Azure Bastion configurations and access controls to identify and mitigate potential vulnerabilities.
Review and update access controls for Azure Bastion to ensure that only necessary users have access, following the principle of least privilege.
Ensure that Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) is enabled for all users accessing Azure Bastion to enhance security.
Regularly back up the configuration settings of Azure Bastion to ensure quick recovery in case of misconfiguration or failure.
Perform incident response drills to prepare the team for potential security incidents involving Azure Bastion. Ensure familiarity with response protocols.
Regularly check the health status of Azure Bastion services to ensure they are operating correctly and securely.
Ensure that the operations team participates in regular security training to stay updated on Azure Bastion security features and best practices.
